data.title: White Columns
data.meta_description: White Columns is New York City’s oldest alternative non-profit space.
data.text:
The thirteenth release from ‘The Sound of White Columns’ is by Milwaukee-based artist David Robbins. Bridging the gap between art and entertainment, ‘Theme Song For An Exhibition’ undermines the serious nature of the art world. On Side B, ‘The Mainstream’ is a pop song originally featured on Robbins’ 2003 TV pilot for the Sundance Channel, The Ice Cream Social. This record was co-released with The Green Gallery in Milwaukee, WI. Additional performers include: Nicole Rogers, Peter Barrickman, Annie Killelea, Didier Leplae and Renato Umali. Additional production by Richard Galling and Evan Gruzis

Side A ‘Theme Song For An Exhibition’

Side B ‘The Mainstream’

7” white vinyl. Edition of 250. 45 RPM
